section.section: A circuit court may propose to the Court of Appeals a change to the circuit court's jury plan at any time, by filing the proposal with the Court of Appeals.
Within 60 days after a circuit court files a proposal under this subsection, the Court of Appeals shall approve or disapprove the proposal.

A proposal approved under this subsection is effective:
61 days after a circuit court files the proposal; or
Any earlier date that the Court of Appeals sets.
If the Court of Appeals orders a circuit court to change its jury plan, the circuit court shall do so.

A change that the Court of Appeals orders is effective:
On the day the Court sets; but
Not later than 90 days after the date of approval of the circuit court's change.
